intro: Ilex martiana, commonly known as the Mexican holly, is a species of evergreen shrub or small tree native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the family Aquifoliaceae and is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and small, glossy leaves. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Ilex martiana typically grows in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping in warm regions.
